thread.section_title: Hotel Victoria - UPDATED 2017 Reviews & Price Comparison (Paris, France) - TripAdvisor
thread.title: You get what you pay for
thread.title_full: You get what you pay for - Review of Hotel Victoria, Paris, France - TripAdvisor

author: l111nyg
title: You get what you pay for
text:
Firstly i know that its a cheap hotel so I wasn't expecting the ritz however what i was greeted with when i finally got into my room (141) after having to wrestle to unlock the door did shock me a little.
-the smell of the room was disgusting, it reeked of cigarette smoke and urine, i bought some air freshener to try help a bit but the smell was horrid and no amount of spray will remove it.
-room was very grubby. carpet had been patched together, windows were filthy, curtains were full of cobwebs, walls had various stains all over them, bed throws smelt like wet animals.
- paint flaking off of roof and areas of walls looked like it had damp coming through. - wifi on 4th floor was really poor
- i think there is a communal shower however i was given no information on this. An information sheet in the room would be great. The room i was in (141) had a single bed, a chair(full of grime), a side table, a tv (french only) and a toilet with a sink. -the area outside the hotel at night is pretty rowdy and having ventured out (to buy air freshener) i witnesses prostitutes working and pimps fighting so i wouldn't recommend it for families.
In general the room was small but this is to be expected for the cost and of course being in paris a lot of rooms are small however if this room had a fresh lick of paint, fresh bedding and the bathroom modernized it would have been more pleasant but unfortunately as it was i found it to be the worst hotel room i have stayed in as it was more like i was squatting in an abandoned room from the 60s The staff were nice enough and the main stairway looked like it had been freshened up but the room was terrible.
